description: From Hindi/Urdu, from Persian حکیم‎ (hakim), from Arabic حَكِيم‎ (ḥakīm, “wise, learned”).

entries.meaning: (South Asia) A doctor, usually practicing traditional medicine.
examples: The second speaks of naturall Philosophy or Physick, and is studyed by the Hackeams or Physitians  […]

description: From Classical Persian حاکم‎ (hākim), from Arabic حَاكِم‎ (ḥākim).

entries.meaning: (historical) A judge or governor in Islamic India.
